summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel regarding granting access to the CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) system for a Special Agent to review evidence related to the Jeffrey Epstein (JE) case. The email shows internal FBI coordination for evidence review in July 2020.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: FBI personnel coordinating access to the CART system for reviewing Epstein evidence.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: FBI personnel responding to a request about system access for Epstein evidence review.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The agent requesting CART access to review Epstein evidence items, noting they had prior access for previous JOCs (likely Joint Operations Centers or cases).

connections.description: Both are FBI forensic examiners/coordinators involved in managing access to the CART system.

events.title: Initial request for CART access
events.description: An email request is made to add a Special Agent to CART to review Jeffrey Epstein evidence items, noting her prior work on the case.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: FBI personnel were coordinating access to the CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) system specifically for reviewing Jeffrey Epstein (JE) evidence in July 2020.
A Special Agent from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit needed access to help review Epstein evidence items.
The Special Agent had prior CAIR (likely a related system) access for previous JOCs (Joint Operations Centers or cases) but it was not current.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing FBI investigative activity related to the Epstein case well after his death in 2019.
